TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MembershipSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection
Public NotInheritable Class MembershipSection Inherits ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Defines configuration settings to support the infrastructure for configuring and managing membership details. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class provides a way to programmatically access and modify the `membership` section in a configuration file.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for several attributes of the `membership` section, which can also be accessed as members of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
The following configuration file example shows how to specify values declaratively for the `membership` section.
``` <system.web> <membership defaultProvider="AspNetSqlMembershipProvider" userIsOnlineTimeWindow="15"> <providers> <add name=" AspNetSqlMembershipProvider" type="System.Web.Security.SqlMembershipProvider, System.Web, Version=2.0.3600.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a" connectionStringName="LocalSqlServer" passwordAttemptThreshold="5" passwordAttemptWindow="10" enablePasswordRetrieval="false" enablePasswordReset="true" requiresQuestionAndAnswer="true" applicationName="/" requiresUniqueEmail="false" passwordFormat="Hashed" description="Stores and retrieves membership data from the local Microsoft SQL Server database." /> </providers> </membership> </system.web> ```
The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/CS/MembershipSection.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/VB/MembershipSection.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.%23ctor%2A> constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class by using the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.GetSection%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DefaultProvider { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.DefaultProvider : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the default provider that is used to manage roles.
Docs.value: The name of a provider in . The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> must match a named value in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file. An empty string (`""`) is not a valid value for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/CS/MembershipSection.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/VB/MembershipSection.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ HashAlgorithmType { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.HashAlgorithmType : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the type of encryption that is used for sensitive membership information.
Docs.value: The type of encryption used to encrypt sensitive membership information.

remarks.format:
## Remarks At run time, the membership system binds to the appropriate hash algorithm type, and then uses this type when encrypting membership information. If the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.HashAlgorithmType%2A> property is not set, the membership system defaults to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection.Validation%2A> property within the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MachineKeySection> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.HashAlgorithmType%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Providers As ProviderSettingsCollection

Docs.value: A that contains the provider's settings, defined within the subsection of the section of the configuration file.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Membership providers are components that provide access to the membership for a site. You can specify membership providers in the `providers` subsection of the `membership` section of the configuration file.
The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.DefaultProvider%2A> property contains the name of the provider that is used by default.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.Providers%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/CS/MembershipSection.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection/VB/MembershipSection.vb#5)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan UserIsOnlineTimeWindow { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow : TimeSpan with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the length of time, in minutes, before a user is no longer considered to be online.
Docs.value: A length of time in minutes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The value for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow%2A> property is calculated by comparing the current time minus the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow%2A> property with the <xref:System.Web.Security.MembershipUser.LastActivityDate%2A> value for the user.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection.UserIsOnlineTimeWindow%2A> property. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.MembershipSection> class.
